text: Great to see some more improvements on Weblate, thanks <@U01N3ET8N82> and <@U027JEHGZRA>. Are we getting close to a patch for R Core? I don't think we've had a patch since Q1 '23 and I'm keen to see the big improvements made since (from R Project Sprint, LatinR Hackathon, Catalan team, etc) making it in to R 4.4.0. We want to make sure <@U01JACR6L7L> has time to review and submit before the feature freeze (fortnight before release, as yet unscheduled but usually around April 20th). So perhaps aim to have a patch ready in a week or so's time? Waiting till end of March may be too late, meaning the Q1 update misses the major release, as it did last year.

has time to review and submit before the feature freeze (fortnight before release, as yet unscheduled but usually around April 20th). So perhaps aim to have a patch ready in a week or so's time? Waiting till end of March may be too late, meaning the Q1 update misses the major release, as it did last year.

text: Hi Heather, cc <@U01KXU8UNRX> & <@U05S0QQCWBW>, thanks for the heads up, do you know whether with the current status of the translation for Catalan (see <https://translate.rx.studio/languages/ca/r-project|here>), are we far enough to make it into a patch? do we need to arrive to 100% in every component, or would it be sufficient to arrive to 100% in a subset of them (so that we may be able to prioritize)? Thanks!

attachments.text: This site runs Weblate for localizing various software projects.

text: I would say yes - you already have greater coverage than Danish, which is already there.

text: we don't really filter for # messages, even one message and a language will be added. because messages always back up to English I think this is fine.

text: A further question on this, I wanted to check on Weblate that the initial copyright and version messages are translated into Catalan. They seem to be printed from functions `PrintGreeting()` and `PrintVersion()` in the source file `src/main/version.c`, but I could not locate the component in Weblate that contains those translations. I thought they could in the `base-c` component, but they are not there. Any hint on how could I check that out? Thanks!

elements.text: A further question on this, I wanted to check on Weblate that the initial copyright and version messages are translated into Catalan. They seem to be printed from functions
, but I could not locate the component in Weblate that contains those translations. I thought they could in the
component, but they are not there. Any hint on how could I check that out? Thanks!

text:
Hey <@U02HVUBA4QY> if you have a local copy of the R sources, you can easily `grep` for this:

```grep -Fr "R is free software" . --include=*.pot
# ./src/library/base/po/R.pot:"R is free software and comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.\n"```
So yes, it should be in the base-c component. However, I'm not seeing it in `ca.po`, I'm not sure why.

text: Hi <@U01N3ET8N82> I’ve updated via `svn up` the R-devel source and I actually do not see the file `src/library/base/po/ca.po` at all, but I thought this makes sense because as Heather said in her first message in this thread, there has no been a patch for translations since Q1'23. I’m attaching a screen capture of what I see in Weblate for the base-c component and it has only 15 strings, so something does not match here.

elements.text: the R-devel source and I actually do not see the file

at all, but I thought this makes sense because as Heather said in her first message in this thread, there has no been a patch for translations since Q1'23. I’m attaching a screen capture of what I see in Weblate for the base-c component and it has only 15 strings, so something does not match here.

text:
OK I:

```msginit -i R.pot -o ca-tmp.po
msgcat -o ca-new.po ca.po ca-tmp.po
# (visually inspect ca-new.po to make sure it looks vaguely OK)
mv ca-new.po ca.po
rm ca-tmp.po
# (now look at git diff to see any other spurious-looking differences)
git commit [...]```
That should ensure Weblate sees all of the strings that are found in the other languages for base C strings. My experience from the last few days is when I commit to this `git` repo it takes a while for Weblate UI to pick up the change.

I couldn't see a way to fix this directly in the Weblate UI, maybe <@U027JEHGZRA> has an idea.

text: If this cannot be fixed in Weblate before generating the patch from the Catalan translations available in Weblate, then I’d like to propose translating just these few first messages from R directly on the `src/library/base/ca/ca.po` file, so that the user notices upfront that a fraction of the messages have been translated.
